[$BOX] [$CELL] [$BLOCK]

Diagnostics

Although laboratory testing is non-diagnostic, serum electrolytes, creatinine, urea, liver function tests, glucose, and arterial blood gases (with lactate) are usually requested to screen for metabolic complications of chlorophenoxy herbicide poisoning. Chest radiography is likewise performed as necessary to determine the extent of pulmonary toxicity in patients with abnormal blood gas values.

[$/BLOCK] [$/CELL] [$/BOX]
